Such travelers must present the following documents:  1.COVID-19 negative PCR test report obtained within 72 hours of entering the country    Exceptions:  Those arriving in Nepal for emergency purposes may be permitted to continue directly to an onward destination after a negative PCR test report is presented, but will still be subject to isolation following local heath protocols.  The government of Nepal has approved exceptions for diplomatic and international organization personnel, and family members of these groups.  No vaccination or testing is required for minors below 5 years old. Vaccinations are not mandatory for children between 5-18 years old, but unvaccinated minors are subject to the same health protocols as unvaccinated adults.
